course_title: Special Topics in Music: Women, Music, & Technology
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 18 / Seats Avail: 12Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
This course examines the use of technology in the artistic output by women composers and performers. Students will gain insight into the remarkable innovations by women artists that have been historically overlooked and marginalized. In addition to class discussions, students will engage with recordings, archival documents, live performances, and in-person guest lectures by notable women in the field today. 
 
No prerequisites.


Music majors: This course counts as elective credit.
course_description: Seminar or lecture series of topics in music. May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
